result.execSummary:
The defendant Jahmel J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.605(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 78 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No contact with: James Madison High School, defendant is not to be within 500 feet.

- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
- Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 10, calendar successor, for review. spc

Count 1.  

(Return address: Jahmel Johnson #653579, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 3310, Oshkosh, WI 54903).

Certification of transcript of proceedings of Sentencing, commencing 03-20-17, received and filed. (22 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Institution.
Denying Motion for Addtional Sentence Credit, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for additional sentence credit.

Defendant Jahmel J Johnson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Jahmel J Johnson in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  31 MONTHS with 78 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 13 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No contact with: James Madison High School, defendant is not to be within 500 feet. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $0 (ZERO); 
Restitution is set at $0 (zero); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Jahmel J Johnson not in court, in custody and not produced to the courtroom.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for sentencing. Due to the Court congestion, Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski is no longer available for today's proceedings. For reasons stated off the record by the state, Case remains calendared for sentencing hearing on March 20, 2017 at 9:00 a.m. All parties are advised effective March 17, 2017 case will be in Room 313 of the Safety Building.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Jahmel J Johnson not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jahmel J Johnson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Jahmel J Johnson in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

For reasons stated on the record by defense counsel, Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  All parties are advised effective February 6, 2017 case will be in Room 512 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 09:00 am.
